#summary Instructions for setting up and configuring GDBE on the AppEngine.

== Before you start ==

  # Sign up for an AppEngine account (free) and create an AppEngine application for hosting GDBE.
  # Download and install <a href="http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/technology/epp/downloads/release/galileo/SR1/eclipse-jee-galileo-SR1-win32.zip">Eclipse</a>, along with the <a href="http://code.google.com/eclipse/">Google Plugin</a>.
  # Download and extract the latest version of GDBE from the <a href="http://code.google.com/p/gdbe/downloads/list">downloads section</a>.

== Open GDBE in Eclipse ==
  # In Eclipse, from the *File* menu, click *Import*. From the Import window select *Existing Projects into Workspace* and click *Next*. [<a href="">Screenshot</a>]
  # Select the GDBE project folder that was downloaded and extracted. Click *Finish*.
